page.title: 01TWO SOUTH CHILTERN VILLAGES
page.content: The area is set high in the South Chilterns and is dissected by the country boundary between Buckinghamshire and Oxfordshire. The hilltops are covered mainly with deciduous woods, beech trees being a predominant feature. Both Ibstone and Northend are examples of Ribbon Linear developments following the natural line of the ridges on which they are situated. The combined population of the two villages is only a few hundred and the vast majority of residents either commute to more urban areas to work or are retired. A large proportion of the land in this area belongs to the Wormsley Estate - a large private country mansion with several small satellite farms. It is these farms and a few additional ones which provide employment in the area. The farmland is to be found in the
